mdRecord.dcterms:title: Flying Yankee, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Budd Company (American manufacturer and metal fabricator, 1912-2014) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Flying Yankee was a diesel-electric streamliner built in 1935 for the Maine Central Railroad and the Boston and Maine Railroad by Budd Company and with mechanical and electrical equipment from Electro-Motive Corporation. It was also the name of a passenger train, the third streamliner train in North America ... It ceased passenger service in 1957. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_Yankee [work]
